kodkod.engine
Class Proof

java.lang.Object
  kodkod.engine.Proof

public final class Proof
extends java.lang.Object

Contains a proof of unsatisfiability of a given FOL formula.

specfield:
formula: Formula // the unsatisfiable formula
bounds: Bounds // the bounds with respect to which the formula is unsatisfiable

Method Summary
 java.util.Iterator<TranslationRecord> core()
          Returns an iterator over the log records for the formulas that are in the unsatisfiable core of this.formula.
 void minimize()
          Minimizes the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability using a variant of the Complete Resolution Refutation algorithm.
 void refine()
          Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability until a fixed point is reached, using the Empty-Clause Cone algorithm.
 double relativeHardness()
          Returns the relative hardness of the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

refine

public void refine()
Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability until a fixed point is reached, using the Empty-Clause Cone algorithm. The resulting proof is not guaranteed to be minimal.

See Also:
L. Zhang and S. Malik. Extracting small unsatisfiable cores from unsatisfiable Boolean formula. In Proceedings of Sixth International Conference on Theory and Applications of Satisfiability Testing (SAT '03). 2003.
effects:
refines this proof until a fixed point is reached.

relativeHardness

public double relativeHardness()
Returns the relative hardness of the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability. The higher this number, the harder the proof is to minimize.

Returns:
the relative hardness of the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability.

minimize

public void minimize()
Minimizes the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability using a variant of the Complete Resolution Refutation algorithm. The speed of minimization corresponds, roughly, to the relative hardness of the proof. In other words, the higher the relative hardness, the longer the minimization process.

See Also:
N. Dershowitz, Z. Hanna, and A. Nadel. A scalable algorithm for minimal unsatisfiable core extraction. In Proceedings of Ninth International Conference on Theory and Applications of Satisfiability Testing (SAT '06). 2006.
effects:
minimizes the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability using a variant of the Complete Resolution Refutation algorithm

core

public java.util.Iterator<TranslationRecord> core()
Returns an iterator over the log records for the formulas that are in the unsatisfiable core of this.formula. The record objects returned by the iterator are not guaranteed to be immutable. In particular, the state of a record object returned by next() is guaranteed to remain the same only until the subsequent call to next().

Returns:
an iterator over the log records for the formulas that are in the unsatisfiable core of this.formula.
